docs.abstract: The president’s China and North American trade pacts reverse a trend of opening markets that was decades in the making.
docs.snippet: The president’s China and North American trade pacts reverse a trend of opening markets that was decades in the making.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For years, America’s trade agreements have tried to break down economic barriers between nations by removing tariffs and other impediments to cross-border commerce. President Trump’s trade deals have turned that approach on its head.

headline.main: Trump’s Trade Deals Raise, Rather Than Remove, Economic Barriers
headline.print_headline: Trump Deals Only Raise  Trade Walls

docs.abstract: A JPMorgan employee and a customer secretly recorded their conversations with bank employees.
docs.snippet: A JPMorgan employee and a customer secretly recorded their conversations with bank employees.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jimmy Kennedy earned $13 million during his nine-year career as a player in the National Football League. He was the kind of person most banks would be happy to have as a client.

headline.main: This Is What Racism Sounds Like in the Banking Industry
headline.print_headline: This Is What Racism Sounds Like in Banking

docs.abstract: The formal accord, after a preliminary deal in October, still requires months of work to integrate the automakers.
docs.snippet: The formal accord, after a preliminary deal in October, still requires months of work to integrate the automakers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fiat Chrysler and PSA of France said Wednesday that they had agreed to the terms of a merger that would create the world’s fourth largest automaker.

headline.main: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot Agree on Terms to Forge New Auto Giant
headline.print_headline: Fiat Chrysler and PSA Adopt Terms to Create 4th-Largest Carmaker

byline.original: By Jack Ewing and Liz Alderman

docs.abstract: Holiday sales can present a prime opportunity for those in the market for a new vehicle — if you’re flexible on the model.
docs.snippet: Holiday sales can present a prime opportunity for those in the market for a new vehicle — if you’re flexible on the model.
docs.lead_paragraph: In one advertisement, a young woman drives home through swirling snowflakes, to be greeted by the family dog. Another depicts a gift-laden pickup hauling a tree sized for Rockefeller Center. A third focuses on a man in a frosty field, hugging a truck.

headline.main: Santa Didn’t Bring a Car? December Is the Best Month for Bargains
headline.print_headline: A Perfect Season for Sipping Cocoa and Kicking Tires

docs.abstract: A key family hauler for much of the 20th century now accounts for a sliver of the American auto market.
docs.snippet: A key family hauler for much of the 20th century now accounts for a sliver of the American auto market.
docs.lead_paragraph: If the automobile business in the United States is indeed a cyclical affair, the station wagon is due for a renaissance.

headline.main: Station Wagons on Endangered List as S.U.V.s Crush All in Their Path
headline.print_headline: Whither the Wagon? Fading Into the Sunset

docs.abstract: With the rise of smartphones and social media, journalists use new methods to track major news events.
docs.snippet: With the rise of smartphones and social media, journalists use new methods to track major news events.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Leaked documents and interviews with whistle-blowing sources will always be a part of investigative journalism. But thanks to the rise of digital technology, and the easy availability of data that has gone with it, reporters have more ways to get stories than ever before.

headline.main: These Reporters Rely on Public Data, Rather Than Secret Sources
headline.print_headline: These Reporters Rely on Public Data, Rather Than Sources

docs.abstract: The economy is relatively strong, and consumers are spending. So why are things so tough for some retailers?
docs.snippet: The economy is relatively strong, and consumers are spending. So why are things so tough for some retailers?
docs.lead_paragraph: Retailers are trying everything they can to keep up with Amazon. Macy’s offers same-day delivery and in-store returns for online purchases. Black Friday deals are already starting at Kohl’s. And craft cocktails are served in the women’s shoe department at Nordstrom.

headline.main: Chasing Amazon, Retailers Are in a Never-Ending Arms Race
headline.print_headline: Retailers Strike Back Against Amazon, but Can They Weather Counterpunches?

byline.original: By Sapna Maheshwari and Michael Corkery
